page.title: 06BUILDINGS IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: In Chardstock there are many council houses in the village.Some of the houses are groups some groups are called The Parade,Westcombes and Green Lane.The Parade by the School was built in the 1920s and Westcombes was built in the 1940s to early 1950s.Most houses round Chardstock are very old some have been let to go to rubble.In Chardstock there is a Garage by a row of houses called Victoria Place the Old Poor House.The garage is used for supplying spare parts and sevicing vehicles.In Tytherleigh there is an Agricultural Supplier named Burgess Norringtons and next to that there is a Burglar alarm firm and a Double Glazing firm.In the centre of the village there are several small trading units,a cream store,a joinery and a garden ornament unit.Near the George Inn is the War Memorial.
